column6: 1.08-1.12 drafters should snag London, our overall WR9, on the comeback since it's unlikely he's available in the third round.
A gift at the second/third-round turn if there.
Do not be afraid to draft him in the early-third round.
Projected to be drafted in the mid-fourth round, we suggest "reaching" for Nabers in the third.
A top-30 player worth being ahead of at the third/fourth-round turn.
Much more palatable in the third round.
Begin eyeing Rice in the sixth round (well ahead of ADP).
A steal in the fifth round.
We are confident in drafting Odunze a full round ahead of ADP.
Typically being forgotten until the 10th, Thomas can be drafted comfortably in the eighth/ninth round.
Stroud would have to win MVP to return value at his current cost. This ranking leaves room for his floor.
A weekly FLEX option, Palmer can be drafted in the 12th round.
Much like Josh Palmer, Shaheed should be coveted one-two rounds earlier than his ADP suggests.
We are expecting Wicks to be drafted multiple rounds after this ranking. Be early.
Odds are Chubb won't be on the board in this range. Drafting him any higher than this suggests a full bill of health, which we're very skeptical of.
